cards.name: Auriok Windwalker
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Attach target Equipment you control to target creature you control.
cards.flavor: Each generation, a handful of Auriok girls are allowed to visit the Cave of Light. They return riding the wind and brandishing steel.

foreignNames.name: オーリオックの風歩き

cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Attach target Equipment you control to target creature you control.

cards.name: Beacon of Immortality
cards.text: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: The cave floods with light. A thousand rays shine forth and meld into one.

rulings.text: If you double a negative life total, you do the real math. A life total of -10 becomes -20.
Beacon of Immortality's effect counts as life gain (or life loss, if the life total was negative) for effects that trigger on or replace life gain (or life loss).
If a Beacon is countered or doesn't resolve, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.

cards.name: Bringer of the White Dawn
cards.text:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the White Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
cards.text: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor: "Memnarch shall rage against us. We shall endure."
cards.originalText: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Leonin Squire
cards.text: When Leonin Squire enters the battlefield, return target artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"I may be kha, but without my soldiers, my people, I am nothing."
—Raksha Golden Cub
cards.originalText: When Leonin Squire comes into play, return target artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Loxodon Anchorite
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: The loxodon ascribe religious superiority to those born albino, believing them to be spiritually pure.

foreignNames.name: ロクソドンの世捨て人

cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Loxodon Stalwart
cards.text:
Vigilance
{W}: Loxodon Stalwart gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Long ago, the Auriok attempted peace with the loxodons. The leonin attempted war. Neither succeeded.
cards.originalText:
Attacking doesn't cause Loxodon Stalwart to tap.
{W}: Loxodon Stalwart gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Raksha Golden Cub
cards.text:
Vigilance
As long as Raksha Golden Cub is equipped, Cat creatures you control get +2/+2 and have double strike.
cards.flavor: Some believe that Raksha, youngest of the kha, is the reincarnation of Dakan, the first and mightiest of leonin leaders.

rulings.text: Raksha Golden Cub is a Cat, so it also gets +2/+2 and double strike if it's equipped.

cards.originalText:
Attacking doesn't cause Raksha Golden Cub to tap.
As long as Raksha is equipped, Cats you control get +2/+2 and have double strike.

cards.name: Retaliate
cards.text: Destroy all creatures that dealt damage to you this turn.
cards.flavor: The Auriok learned perseverance from their forebears. They learned justice from the leonin.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures that dealt damage to you this turn.

cards.name: Roar of Reclamation
cards.text: Each player returns all artifact cards from their graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Yesterday's relics will determine the outcome of tomorrow's war."
—Ushanti, leonin seer
cards.originalText: Each player returns all artifact cards from his or her graveyard to play.

cards.name: Skyhunter Prowler
cards.text: Flying, vigilance (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor:
"If what I have seen comes to pass, we will need our guardians more than ever."
—Ushanti, leonin seer
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Skyhunter Prowler to tap.

cards.name: Skyhunter Skirmisher
cards.text: Flying, double strike
cards.flavor:
"Like dawn's first light, blind the unprepared and banish the shadows."
—Skyhunter creed
cards.originalText: Flying, double strike

cards.name: Stand Firm
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Scry 2 (Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Stasis Cocoon
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
cards.flavor: Though the grip of a golem is strong, the grip of Auriok magic is far stronger.

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted artifact's activated abilities can't be played.
If enchanted artifact is a creature, it can't attack or block.

cards.name: Steelshaper's Gift
cards.text: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Some blades seek their own wielders.
cards.originalText: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Vanquish
cards.text: Destroy target blocking creature.
cards.flavor:
"All beings have an inner light. Let me show you yours."
—Ushanti, leonin seer
cards.originalText: Destroy target blocking creature.

cards.name: Acquire
cards.text: Search target opponent's library for an artifact card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles their library.
cards.flavor: Sometimes "innovation" means "stealing another's secret before anyone else can."
cards.originalText: Search target opponent's library for an artifact card and put that card into play under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Advanced Hoverguard
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Advanced Hoverguard gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"They are like their vedalken masters: untouchable, aloof, and omnipresent."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader
cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}: Advanced Hoverguard can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.

cards.name: Artificer's Intuition
cards.text: {U}, Discard an artifact card: Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: {U}, Discard an artifact card from your hand: Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Beacon of Tomorrows
cards.text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one. Shuffle Beacon of Tomorrows into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: To look into its light is to meet the gaze of history.

rulings.text: If a Beacon is countered or doesn't resolve, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Target player takes an extra turn after this one. Shuffle Beacon of Tomorrows into its owner's library.

cards.name: Blinkmoth Infusion
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Untap all artifacts.
cards.flavor: Power begets power.

rulings.text: If you control no artifacts, Blinkmoth Infusion costs twelve generic mana and two blue mana to cast.
Blinkmoth Infusion untaps all artifacts on the battlefield, not just artifacts you control.

cards.originalText:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to play for each artifact you control.)
Untap all artifacts.

cards.name: Bringer of the Blue Dawn
cards.text:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may draw two cards.
cards.originalText:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the Blue Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may draw two cards.

cards.name: Condescend
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

rulings.text: You must be able to target another spell to cast Condescend. Condescend can't target itself.
You scry 2 even if the spell's controller pays {X}.

cards.originalText:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.
Scry 2 (Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Disruption Aura
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay its mana cost."
cards.flavor: Vedalken weapons sold to outsiders are as dependable as the vedalken themselves.

rulings.text: Mana cost includes any requirements for colored mana, although most artifacts don't have any color requirements.
If the enchanted artifact has X in its mana cost, X is 0.

cards.originalText: Enchanted artifact has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay its mana cost."

cards.name: Early Frost
cards.text: Tap up to three target lands.
cards.flavor: Under its mists, the earth sleeps.
cards.originalText: Tap up to three target lands.

cards.name: Eyes of the Watcher
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

rulings.text: You do the scrying at the end of the ability's resolution (assuming you pay {1}).

cards.originalText: Whenever you play an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Fold into Aether
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, its controller may put a creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Æther portals drift across Mirrodin's surface, dragging creatures across time and space.

rulings.text: If the spell isn't countered (because it's a spell that can't be countered, for example), nothing happens.
If your Fold into Aether counters a spell you control, you get to put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. If you do, that spell's controller may put a creature card from his or her hand into play.

cards.name: Hoverguard Sweepers
cards.text:
Flying
When Hoverguard Sweepers enters the battlefield, you may return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: They only appear in emergencies, and emergencies never last long.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Hoverguard Sweepers comes into play, you may return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Into Thin Air
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Return target artifact to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Perhaps I should take Mirrodin apart and begin again."
—Memnarch
cards.originalText:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to play for each artifact you control.)
Return target artifact to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Plasma Elemental
cards.text: Plasma Elemental can't be blocked.
cards.flavor:
"I watched a ship sail right through it. I thought it was harmless . . . until I saw what it had done to the crew."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader
cards.originalText: Plasma Elemental is unblockable.

cards.name: Qumulox
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Even the clouds bend themselves to Memnarch's will, eager to swallow those who oppose him.
cards.originalText:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to play for each artifact you control.)
Flying

cards.name: Serum Visions
cards.text: Draw a card. Scry 2.
cards.originalText:
Draw a card.
Scry 2 (Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Spectral Shift
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
• Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: Because of updated targeting rulings, it's possible to target the same spell or permanent with both abilities when cast with Entwine.

cards.originalText:
Choose one Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another; or change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (These effects don't end at end of turn.)
Entwine {2}

cards.name: Thought Courier
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: It is telling of the vedalkens' culture that they trust human couriers more than their own comrades.
cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Trinket Mage
cards.text: When Trinket Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: If the mana cost of a card in your library includes {X}, X is considered to be 0.

cards.originalText: When Trinket Mage comes into play, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Vedalken Mastermind
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The vedalken see other beings from a cold distance, as either experimental subjects or objects of study.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Beacon of Unrest
cards.text: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: A vertical scream pierces the night air and echoes doom through the clouds.

rulings.text: If a Beacon is countered or doesn't resolve, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard into play under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.

cards.name: Blind Creeper
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Blind Creeper gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It shuns everything except its next meal.

rulings.text: This ability triggers off anyone casting a spell, including you, not just Blind Creeper's controller or an opponent.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, Blind Creeper gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Bringer of the Black Dawn
cards.text:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay 2 life. If you do, search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
cards.originalText:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the Black Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay 2 life. If you do, search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

cards.name: Cackling Imp
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Its laughter drives needles through your mind.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Desecration Elemental
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever a player casts a spell, sacrifice a creature.
cards.flavor: Its precious corpses dance like puppets to attract mindless nim prey.

rulings.text: This ability triggers off anyone casting a spell, including you, not just Desecration Elemental's controller or an opponent.
If Desecration Elemental is the only creature you control when its triggered ability resolves, you'll have to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText:
Fear
Whenever a player plays a spell, sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Devour in Shadow
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor:
"Feel the burn of the mists. Master them. They will devour your enemies."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.

cards.name: Dross Crocodile
cards.flavor: The necrogen may have taken its sight, but it can still taste the fear of its prey.

foreignNames.name: ドロスのクロコダイル

cards.name: Ebon Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a player casts a spell, you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: The deadliest killers serve only those who are not afraid to die.

rulings.text: This ability triggers off anyone casting a spell, including you, not just Ebon Drake's controller or an opponent.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a player plays a spell, you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Endless Whispers
cards.text: Each creature has "When this creature dies, choose target opponent. That player puts this card from its owner's graveyard onto the battlefield under their control at the beginning of the next end step."
cards.flavor: Those who find death under the black sun's shadow cannot escape its pull.

rulings.text: The creatures have the triggered ability, so each creature's controller chooses one of their opponents to target.

cards.originalText: Each creature has "When this creature is put into a graveyard from play, choose target opponent. That player puts this creature card from that graveyard into play under his or her control at end of turn."

cards.name: Fill with Fright
cards.text: Target player discards two cards. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.originalText:
Target player discards two cards from his or her hand.
Scry 2 (Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Fleshgrafter
cards.text: Discard an artifact card: Fleshgrafter gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Necrogen enflames certain emotional centers in the Morioks' brains: hate, aggression, and especially greed.
cards.originalText: Discard an artifact card from your hand: Fleshgrafter gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lose Hope
cards.text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Scry 2 (Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Mephidross Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
Each creature you control is a Vampire in addition to its other creature types and has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."

rulings.text: The triggered ability Mephidross Vampire grants to each creature you control triggers on any damage dealt to any creature, not just combat damage.

foreignNames.name: メフィドロスの吸血鬼

cards.originalText:
Flying
Each creature you control is a Vampire in addition to its other creature types and has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."

cards.name: Moriok Rigger
cards.text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Moriok Rigger.
cards.flavor: The Moriok scavenge for weapons, for armor, for food—and ultimately for their souls.
cards.originalText: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from play, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Moriok Rigger.

cards.name: Night's Whisper
cards.text: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: The Moriok call the black moon the Whisperer. At her apex, she whispers of power.
cards.originalText: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Nim Grotesque
cards.text: Nim Grotesque gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
cards.flavor: In the swirling mists, you could walk right up to one and not know until its teeth are in your throat.
cards.originalText: Nim Grotesque gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.

cards.name: Plunge into Darkness
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Sacrifice any number of creatures. You gain 3 life for each sacrificed creature.
• Pay X life, then look at the top X cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand and exile the rest.
Entwine {B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: Everything other than the mode/entwine choice (and paying the {1}{B}, of course) is done on resolution.

Assuming the entwine cost has been paid, the effect is (1) sacrifice any number of creatures, (2) gain 3 life for each sacrificed creature, (3) choose X, (4) pay X life, and (5) look at the top X cards of your library, put one into your hand, and exile the rest.

cards.originalText:
Choose one Sacrifice any number of creatures, then you gain 3 life for each sacrificed creature; or pay X life, then look at the top X cards of your library, put one of those cards into your hand, and remove the rest from the game.
Entwine {B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Relentless Rats
cards.text:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

rulings.text: The second ability of Relentless Rats lets you ignore the "four-of" rule. It doesn't let you ignore format legality. For example, during a Masters 25 Limited event, you can't add Relentless Rats from your personal collection.

cards.originalText:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature in play named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

cards.name: Shattered Dreams
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose an artifact card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: Victims are lucky if they remember ever having had what was lost.
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose an artifact card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Vicious Betrayal
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice any number of creatures.
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature sacrificed this way.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Vicious Betrayal, sacrifice any number of creatures.
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature sacrificed this way.

cards.name: Beacon of Destruction
cards.text: Beacon of Destruction deals 5 damage to any target. Shuffle Beacon of Destruction into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: The Great Furnace's blessing is a spectacular sight, but the best view comes at a high cost.

rulings.text: If a Beacon is countered or doesn't resolve, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Beacon of Destruction deals 5 damage to target creature or player. Shuffle Beacon of Destruction into its owner's library.

cards.name: Bringer of the Red Dawn
cards.text:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the Red Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Cosmic Larva
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Cosmic Larva unless you sacrifice two lands.
cards.flavor: For millennia they wandered from plane to plane, devouring all metal. Finally, their wanderings are over.
cards.originalText:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Cosmic Larva unless you sacrifice two lands.

cards.name: Feedback Bolt
cards.text: Feedback Bolt deals damage to target player or planeswalker equal to the number of artifacts you control.
cards.flavor: The path of least resistance is often through your enemies.
cards.originalText: Feedback Bolt deals damage to target player equal to the number of artifacts you control.

cards.name: Furnace Whelp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Brawler
cards.text:
First strike
Goblin Brawler can't be equipped.
cards.flavor: Perhaps he shuns technology. Perhaps he appreciates nature. Perhaps he doesn't know the difference.

rulings.text: You can activate an equip ability that targets Goblin Brawler, but the Equipment will fail to move onto it.

cards.originalText:
First strike
Goblin Brawler can't be equipped.

cards.name: Granulate
cards.text: Destroy each nonland artifact with converted mana cost 4 or less.
cards.flavor: There aren't that many ways to destroy a solid steel weapon, but somehow the goblins keep finding new ones.
cards.originalText: Destroy each nonland artifact with converted mana cost 4 or less.

cards.name: Ion Storm
cards.text: {1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter or a charge counter from a permanent you control: Ion Storm deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: When enough artifacts lie too long in the same place, their magical radiation weakens reality, opening rifts of unpredictable destructive power.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter or a charge counter from a permanent you control: Ion Storm deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Iron-Barb Hellion
cards.text:
Haste
Iron-Barb Hellion can't block.
cards.flavor: When you feel a rumble in the ground, hold perfectly still. One sound will bring the hellion.
cards.originalText:
Haste
Iron-Barb Hellion can't block.

cards.name: Krark-Clan Engineers
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice two artifacts: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: "Well, I jammed the whatsit into the whackdoodle, but I think I broke the thingamajigger."
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice two artifacts: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Krark-Clan Ogre
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: The Krark Clan believes it's caught an ogre. The ogre believes he's caught seven goblins.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Magma Giant
cards.text: When Magma Giant enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: Its open mouth is a furnace blast that blisters the skin. Its smoking fists are meteors that split the earth.
cards.originalText: When Magma Giant comes into play, it deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Magma Jet
cards.text: Magma Jet deals 2 damage to any target. Scry 2.

rulings.text: When you scry, you may put all the cards you look at back on top of your library, you may put all of those cards on the bottom of your library, or you may put some of those cards on top and the rest of them on the bottom.
You choose how to order cards returned to your library after scrying no matter where you put them.
You perform the actions stated on a card in sequence. For some spells and abilities, that means you'll scry last. For others, that means you'll scry and then perform other actions.

Scry appears on some spells and abilities with one or more targets. If all of the spell or ability's targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't scry.

cards.originalText:
Magma Jet deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Scry 2 (Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Magnetic Theft
cards.text: Attach target Equipment to target creature. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)
cards.flavor: Among the Vulshok, the most prized blades are those that killed their original owners.

rulings.text: Magnetic Theft can cause an Equipment one player controls to be attached to a creature another player controls. The controller of the Equipment can pay the equip cost to move the Equipment to a creature they control (but only any time that player could cast a sorcery).

cards.originalText: Attach target Equipment to target creature. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)

cards.name: Mana Geyser
cards.text: Add {R} for each tapped land your opponents control.
cards.flavor: The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.
cards.originalText: Add {R} to your mana pool for each tapped land your opponents control.

cards.name: Rain of Rust
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Destroy target land.
Entwine {3}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.flavor: On Mirrodin, mages who call upon the power of rust are shunned by their people and often turn mercenary to survive.
cards.originalText:
Choose one Destroy target artifact; or destroy target land.
Entwine {3}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Reversal of Fortune
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You may copy an instant or sorcery card in it. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.
cards.flavor: "Why learn hundreds of spells when you can learn only one and use it to steal hundreds?"

rulings.text: Reversal of Fortune creates a copy of the card in the other player's hand, then allows you to cast the copy from that player's hand without paying its mana cost.
You cast the copy while this ability is resolving and still on the stack. Normally, you're not allowed to cast spells or activate abilities at this time. Reversal of Fortune provides an exception.
You don't pay the spell's mana cost. If the spell has X in its mana cost, X is 0. You do pay any additional costs for that spell. You can't use any alternative costs.
If the copied card is a split card, you may choose to cast either side of the split card but not both.

You can't cast the copy if an effect prevents you from casting instants or sorceries, or from casting that particular instant or sorcery. It doesn't matter whether your opponent can cast the card at this time; the only thing that matters is whether you can cast it.
You can't cast the copy unless all of its targets, if any, can be chosen.
If you don't want to cast the copy, you can choose not to; the copy ceases to exist the next time state-based actions are checked.
The spell is cast from your opponent's hand, not yours, which can be important for some cards.
The creation of the copy and then the casting of the copy are both optional.

cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You may copy an instant or sorcery card in it and play the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Screaming Fury
cards.text: Target creature gets +5/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: He's got an axe to grind.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +5/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Spark Elemental
cards.text:
Trample, haste (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking. This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Spark Elemental.
cards.flavor: Vulshok shamans summon spark elementals to burn paths through thick underbrush—or through goblin salvage squads.
cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
At end of turn, sacrifice Spark Elemental.

cards.name: Vulshok Sorcerer
cards.text:
Haste
{T}: Vulshok Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Vulshok sorcerers train by leaping into electrified storm clouds. Dead or alive, they come back down with smiles on their faces.

foreignNames.name: ヴァルショクの魔術師

cards.originalText:
Haste
{T}: Vulshok Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: All Suns' Dawn
cards.text: For each color, return up to one target card of that color from your graveyard to your hand. Exile All Suns' Dawn.

rulings.text: All Suns' Dawn can have from zero to five targets, one for each color.
You can target two blue-and-white multicolored cards by choosing one as the blue card and one as the white card.

You choose the color each target must be when you choose it as a target, so if the card you targeted as a blue card is red when All Suns' Dawn resolves, the card is an illegal target, even if the spell doesn't target another red card.

cards.originalText: For each color, return up to one target card of that color from your graveyard to your hand. Then remove All Suns' Dawn from the game.

cards.name: Beacon of Creation
cards.text: Create a 1/1 green Insect creature token for each Forest you control. Shuffle Beacon of Creation into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: A chorus of life heralds the arrival of Mirrodin's final sun.

rulings.text: If a Beacon is countered or doesn't resolve, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token into play for each Forest you control. Shuffle Beacon of Creation into its owner's library.

cards.name: Bringer of the Green Dawn
cards.text:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
cards.originalText:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the Green Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 3/3 green Beast creature token into play.

cards.name: Channel the Suns
cards.text: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}.
cards.flavor: To some the birth of the fifth sun was a sign of doom. To others it was a sign of salvation. But to all it was a sign.
cards.originalText: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Dawn's Reflection
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional two mana in any combination of colors.
cards.flavor: Only Sylvok magic could truly capture the perfection of a Mirrodin sunrise.

rulings.text: The controller of the land gets the additional mana, not the controller of the enchantment.
The two mana can be of two different colors. The controller of the land chooses the colors.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds two mana of any combination of colored mana to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Eternal Witness
cards.text: When Eternal Witness enters the battlefield, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: She remembers every word spoken, from the hero's oath to the baby's cry.
cards.originalText: When Eternal Witness comes into play, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Fangren Pathcutter
cards.text: Whenever Fangren Pathcutter attacks, attacking creatures gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Tracking a fangren pack is easy. Catching up to one is fatal."
—Viridian scout

foreignNames.name: 路を拓くファングレン

cards.originalText: Whenever Fangren Pathcutter attacks, attacking creatures gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Ferocious Charge
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Scry 2 (Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Joiner Adept
cards.text: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor: A talented apprentice makes all things. The master makes all things possible.

rulings.text: Each land you control gets this ability.

cards.originalText: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Ouphe Vandals
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice Ouphe Vandals: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source and destroy that artifact if it's on the battlefield. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
cards.flavor: The ouphes finally managed to still the clockwork monstrosity by catching themselves in its cogs.

rulings.text: The ability targets an ability on the stack, not the artifact, so it can destroy an artifact with protection from green or one that can't be targeted by spells and abilities.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText: {G}, Sacrifice Ouphe Vandals: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source and destroy that artifact if it's in play. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

cards.name: Rite of Passage
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it. (The damage is dealt before the counter is put on.)
cards.flavor: Every scar is a lesson, every battle a test of what you have learned.

rulings.text: If the creature is dealt damage by more than one source at the same time, it gets only one counter.
The creature doesn't get a counter if all the damage that would be dealt to it is prevented.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it. (The damage is dealt before the counter is put on.)

cards.name: Rude Awakening
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Untap all lands you control.
• Until end of turn, lands you control become 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
Entwine {2}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.
Lands that enter the battlefield or otehrwise come under your control after Rude Awakening resolves won't be affected.

cards.originalText:
Choose one Untap all lands you control; or until end of turn, lands you control become 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
Entwine {2}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Sylvok Explorer
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
cards.flavor: Any creature on a druid's shoulder is his family, any land under his feet his home.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.name: Tangle Asp
cards.text: Whenever Tangle Asp blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"I have no fangs, yet I constantly bite. I have no scales, yet I slither through you. What am I?"
—Riddle of the viper's venom
cards.originalText: Whenever Tangle Asp blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Tel-Jilad Justice
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.originalText:
Destroy target artifact.
Scry 2 (Look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Tel-Jilad Lifebreather
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor: "The Tangle loans you life. Spend it well."

foreignNames.name: テル＝ジラードの息吹使い

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Tornado Elemental
cards.text:
When Tornado Elemental enters the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText:
When Tornado Elemental comes into play, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Tyrranax
cards.text: {1}{G}: Tyrranax gets -1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It outnumbers you one to many.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Tyrranax gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Viridian Lorebearers
cards.text: {3}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts your opponents control.
cards.flavor: A small band of elves pledged many years ago to avoid the Edges of Forgetting. They have remained hidden until now.

foreignNames.name: ヴィリジアンの知恵者

cards.originalText: {3}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts your opponents control.

cards.name: Viridian Scout
cards.text: {2}{G}, Sacrifice Viridian Scout: It deals 2 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: They know a hoverguard's only blind spot is directly above it.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}, Sacrifice Viridian Scout: Viridian Scout deals 2 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Anodet Lurker
cards.text: When Anodet Lurker dies, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: These machines build fearsome visages out of scrap metal to scare off predators who would otherwise be eager to consume them.
cards.originalText: When Anodet Lurker is put into a graveyard from play, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Arachnoid
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It follows the green sun over Mirrodin's surface, spinning massive webs of whispersilk as it goes.
cards.originalText: Arachnoid may block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Arcbound Wanderer
cards.text: Modular—Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

rulings.text: This card has modular—sunburst, a combination of two keyword abilities. The sunburst ability sets the number for the modular ability. Basically, the number of +1/+1 counters the Wanderer gets as it enters the battlefield is equal to the number of colors of mana used to pay its cost.

For the leaves-the-battlefield ability, the number of counters on Arcbound Wanderer at the time it left the battlefield is what's relevant; the number of colors of mana used to pay its cost doesn't matter anymore.
When the Wanderer leaves the battlefield, you may put the counters onto a single target artifact creature. You can't split them among two or more artifact creatures.

If this creature gets enough -1/-1 counters put on it to cause its toughness to be 0 or less (or the damage marked on it to be lethal), modular will put a number of +1/+1 counters on the target artifact creature equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on this creature before it left the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Modular—Sunburst (This comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana used to pay its cost. When it's put into a graveyard, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Avarice Totem
cards.text: {5}: Exchange control of Avarice Totem and target nonland permanent.
cards.flavor: Souls and steel, the essence of Mirrodin. Memnarch lacks one but has an abundance of the other.

rulings.text: It is possible to activate this ability in response to itself and generate some odd combinations. For example, if you control this card and another permanent, you can use this card's ability and target the permanent you control. You can then use this card's ability again and target a permanent your opponent controls. The second usage resolves first and you get your opponent's permanent in exchange for this one. The first usage then resolves and swaps your other permanent for the Totem so you get it back. The net effect is that you can swap any non-land permanent you have for any of theirs if you can activate this ability twice. Note that your opponent does get the chance to use the Totem in between the resolutions of your two usages if they have the mana.

cards.originalText: {5}: Exchange control of Avarice Totem and target nonland permanent.
